title: As Children’s Covid-19 Vaccine Nears, Some Parents of Kids Under 5 Feel Left Behind
sub_head: ‘It’s hard to know we can’t get the vaccine,’ says a mom of two boys who will be too young to get Pfizer-BioNTech’s vaccine when it’s authorized for 5- to 11-year-olds
body:
Parents of children ages 5 to 11 will likely soon be able to vaccinate their children against Covid-19. Those with younger children have a longer wait.
Jennifer Geyer’s daughters, 3-year-old Abigail and 4-month-old Elizabeth, are too young for the shots. Ms. Geyer, who lives in West Chester, Pa., had childhood asthma and worries that her children might suffer lingering respiratory problems if they got Covid-19. She is also worried they might infect her 85-year-old father during family gatherings.
